isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR - 1992 - 1993 - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - SERVICE DIAGNOSTICS

svcsubproc.title: Engine Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: The Engine Warning Light is located on the instrument panel and performs three functions.

item.para: The Engine Warning Light alerts the driver when the engine control system requires service. The light comes ON and blinks every five seconds whenever an ACTIVE fault code is present.

The Engine Warning Light is turned ON as part of a system test each time the vehicle is started. When the key is turned to the IGN position, the Engine Warning Light comes ON for approximately 6 seconds and goes out after the engine is started.
If the Engine Warning Light comes ON and stays ON after initial engine start up, the ECM has detected a problem.
The Engine Warning Light can be used to flash diagnostic codes so that the codes can be read without using an electronic service tool. Refer to DIAGNOSTICS.

svcsubproc.para: The Engine Warning light voltage source is J1 Ignition Connector. The Engine Warning light is grounded by circuit 97AT through the cab and engine harness, through OEM connector (191) terminal 29 by an ECM ground switch. The ECM applies 12V (LIGHT OFF) or 0 volts (LIGHT ON) to circuit 97AT in response to ECM programming and engine conditions.

svcsubproc.title: Data Link Connector (137)
svcsubproc.para: The Data Link 8 pin connector (137) allows Electronic Service Tools (EST) to communicate with the ECM. Data Link connector (137) is located on left instrument panel. Four of the eight Data Link connector cavities have terminals. Those terminal/ circuits are as follows:

item.para: Terminal 1, circuit 98A(+) is the positive data link connection to the ECM through OEM connector (191) terminal 32.
Terminal 2, circuit 98C(-) is the negative (-) data link connection to the ECM through OEM connector (191) terminal 21. The positive and negative data link circuits are a twisted pair of wires.

Terminal 3, circuit 97DL supplies ignition voltage (12V) for electronic service tools, when the key is ON. Circuit 97DL receives power from the Run Relay (183), circuits 97S/97L/97AR/97D through 10A fuse H3 and 20A fuse D3.
Terminal 5, circuit 11-GL is grounded by circuit 11-GL/97-GA/97-G at OEM connector (191) terminal 2.
